00010 class ImageFormat_png: public FileFormat
00011 {
00012 protected:
00013     std::string suffixes( io_modes /*modes = both */ )const {
00014         return std::string( ".png" );
00015     }
00016     struct Reader {
00017         virtual data::Chunk operator()( png_structp png_ptr, png_infop info_ptr )const = 0;
00018         virtual ~Reader() {}
00019     };
00020     template<typename TYPE> struct GenericReader: Reader {
00021         data::Chunk operator()( png_structp png_ptr, png_infop info_ptr )const {
00022             const png_uint_32 width = png_get_image_width ( png_ptr, info_ptr );
00023             const png_uint_32 height = png_get_image_height ( png_ptr, info_ptr );
00024             data::Chunk ret = data::MemChunk<TYPE >( width, height );
00025 
00026             /* png needs a pointer to each row */
00027             boost::scoped_array<png_bytep> row_pointers( new png_bytep[height] );
00028 
00029             for ( unsigned short r = 0; r < height; r++ )
00030                 row_pointers[r] = ( png_bytep )&ret.voxel<TYPE>( 0, r );
00031 
00032             png_read_image( png_ptr, row_pointers.get() );
00033             return ret;
00034         }
00035     };
00036     std::map<png_byte, std::map<png_byte, boost::shared_ptr<Reader> > > readers;
00037 public:
00038     ImageFormat_png() {
00039         readers[PNG_COLOR_TYPE_GRAY][8].reset( new GenericReader<uint8_t> );
00040         readers[PNG_COLOR_TYPE_GRAY][16].reset( new GenericReader<uint16_t> );
00041         readers[PNG_COLOR_TYPE_RGB][8].reset( new GenericReader<util::color24> );
00042         readers[PNG_COLOR_TYPE_RGB][16].reset( new GenericReader<util::color48> );
00043     }
00044     std::string getName()const {
00045         return "PNG (Portable Network Graphics)";
00046     }
00047     std::string dialects( const std::string &/*filename*/ ) const {
00048         return "middle";
00049     }
00050     bool write_png( const std::string &filename, const data::Chunk &buff, int color_type, int bit_depth ) {
00051         FILE *fp;
00052         png_structp png_ptr;
00053         png_infop info_ptr;
00054         assert( buff.getRelevantDims() == 2 );
00055         util::vector4<size_t> size = buff.getSizeAsVector();
00056 
00057         /* open the file */
00058         fp = fopen( filename.c_str(), "wb" );
00059 
00060         if ( fp == NULL ) {
00061             throwSystemError( errno, std::string( "Failed to open " ) + filename );
00062             return 0;
00063         }
00064 
00065         /* Create and initialize the png_struct with the desired error handler
00066         * functions.  If you want to use the default stderr and longjump method,
00067         * you can supply NULL for the last three parameters.  We also check that
00068         * the library version is compatible with the one used at compile time,
00069         * in case we are using dynamically linked libraries.  REQUIRED.
00070         */
00071         png_ptr = png_create_write_struct( PNG_LIBPNG_VER_STRING, NULL /*user_error_ptr*/, NULL /*user_error_fn*/, NULL /*user_warning_fn*/ );
00072 
00073         if ( png_ptr == NULL ) {
00074             fclose( fp );
00075             throwSystemError( errno, "png_create_write_struct failed" );
00076             return 0;
00077         }
00078 
00079         /* Allocate/initialize the image information data.  REQUIRED */
00080         info_ptr = png_create_info_struct( png_ptr );
00081 
00082         if ( info_ptr == NULL ) {
00083             fclose( fp );
00084             throwSystemError( errno, "png_create_info_struct failed" );
00085             return 0;
00086         }
00087 
00088         /* Set error handling.  REQUIRED if you aren't supplying your own
00089         * error handling functions in the png_create_write_struct() call.
00090         */
00091         if ( setjmp( png_jmpbuf( png_ptr ) ) ) {
00092             /* If we get here, we had a problem writing the file */
00093             fclose( fp );
00094             png_destroy_write_struct( &png_ptr, &info_ptr );
00095             throwSystemError( errno, std::string( "Could not write to " ) + filename );
00096             return false;
00097         }
00098 
00099         // check the image sizes
00100         if( size[data::rowDim] > png_get_user_width_max( png_ptr ) ) {
00101             LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Sorry the image is to wide to be written as PNG (maximum is " << png_get_user_width_max( png_ptr ) << ")";
00102         }
00103 
00104         if( size[data::columnDim] > png_get_user_height_max( png_ptr ) ) {
00105             LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Sorry the image is to high to be written as PNG (maximum is " << png_get_user_height_max( png_ptr ) << ")";
00106         }
00107 
00108         /* set up the output control if you are using standard C streams */
00109         png_init_io( png_ptr, fp );
00110         png_set_IHDR( png_ptr, info_ptr, ( png_uint_32 )size[0], ( png_uint_32 )size[1], bit_depth, color_type, PNG_INTERLACE_NONE, PNG_COMPRESSION_TYPE_DEFAULT, PNG_FILTER_TYPE_DEFAULT );
00111 
00112         /* png needs a pointer to each row */
00113         png_byte **row_pointers = new png_byte*[size[1]];
00114         row_pointers[0] = ( png_byte * )buff.getValuePtrBase().getRawAddress().get();
00115 
00116         for ( unsigned short r = 1; r < size[1]; r++ )
00117             row_pointers[r] = row_pointers[0] + ( buff.bytesPerVoxel() * buff.getLinearIndex( util::vector4<size_t>( 0, r, 0, 0 ) ) );
00118 
00119         png_set_rows( png_ptr, info_ptr, row_pointers );
00120 
00121         /* This is the easy way.  Use it if you already have all the
00122         * image info living info in the structure.  You could "|" many
00123         * PNG_TRANSFORM flags into the png_transforms integer here.
00124         */
00125         png_write_png( png_ptr, info_ptr, PNG_TRANSFORM_IDENTITY, NULL );
00126 
00127         /* clean up after the write, and free any memory allocated */
00128         png_destroy_write_struct( &png_ptr, &info_ptr );
00129         delete[] row_pointers;
00130 
00131         /* close the file */
00132         fclose( fp );
00133 
00134         /* that's it */
00135         return true;
00136     }
00137 
00138     data::Chunk read_png( const std::string &filename ) {
00139         png_byte header[8]; // 8 is the maximum size that can be checked
00140 
00141         /* open file and test for it being a png */
00142         FILE *fp = fopen( filename.c_str(), "rb" );
00143 
00144         if ( !fp ) {
00145             throwSystemError( errno, std::string( "Could not open " ) + filename );
00146         }
00147 
00148         if( fread( header, 1, 8, fp ) != 8 ) {
00149             throwSystemError( errno, std::string( "Could not open " ) + filename );
00150         }
00151 
00152         ;
00153 
00154         if ( png_sig_cmp( header, 0, 8 ) ) {
00155             throwGenericError( filename + " is not recognized as a PNG file" );
00156         }
00157 
00158         png_structp png_ptr;
00159         png_infop info_ptr;
00160 
00161         /* initialize stuff */
00162         png_ptr = png_create_read_struct( PNG_LIBPNG_VER_STRING, NULL, NULL, NULL );
00163         assert( png_ptr );
00164 
00165         info_ptr = png_create_info_struct( png_ptr );
00166         assert( info_ptr );
00167 
00168         png_init_io( png_ptr, fp );
00169         png_set_sig_bytes( png_ptr, 8 );
00170         png_read_info( png_ptr, info_ptr );
00171         png_set_interlace_handling( png_ptr );
00172         png_read_update_info( png_ptr, info_ptr );
00173         const png_byte color_type = png_get_color_type ( png_ptr, info_ptr );
00174         const png_byte bit_depth = png_get_bit_depth( png_ptr, info_ptr );
00175         boost::shared_ptr< Reader > reader = readers[color_type][bit_depth];
00176 
00177         if( !reader ) {
00178             LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Sorry, the color type " << ( int )color_type << " with " << ( int )bit_depth << " bits is not supportet.";
00179             throwGenericError( "Wrong color type" );
00180         }
00181 
00182         data::Chunk ret = ( *reader )( png_ptr, info_ptr );
00183 
00184         fclose( fp );
00185         LOG( Runtime, notice ) << ret.getSizeAsString() << "-image loaded from png. Making up acquisitionNumber,columnVec,indexOrigin,rowVec and voxelSize";
00186         ret.setPropertyAs<uint32_t>( "acquisitionNumber", 0 );
00187         ret.setPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "rowVec", util::fvector4( 1, 0 ) );
00188         ret.setPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "columnVec", util::fvector4( 0, 1 ) );
00189         ret.setPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "indexOrigin", util::fvector4( 0, 0 ) );
00190         ret.setPropertyAs<util::fvector4>( "voxelSize", util::fvector4( 1, 1, 1 ) );
00191         return ret;
00192     }
00193     int load ( std::list<data::Chunk> &chunks, const std::string &filename, const std::string &/*dialect*/ )  throw( std::runtime_error & ) {
00194         chunks.push_back( read_png( filename ) );
00195         return 0;
00196     }
00197 
00198     void write( const data::Image &image, const std::string &filename, const std::string &dialect )  throw( std::runtime_error & ) {
00199         const short unsigned int isis_data_type = image.getMajorTypeID();
00200 
00201         data::Image tImg = image;
00202         tImg.convertToType( isis_data_type ); // make image have unique type
00203 
00204         if( image.getRelevantDims() < 2 ) { // ... make sure its made of slices
00205             throwGenericError( "Cannot write png when image is made of stripes" );
00206         }
00207 
00208         tImg.spliceDownTo( data::sliceDim );
00209         std::vector<data::Chunk > chunks = tImg.copyChunksToVector( false ); // and get a list of the slices
00210 
00211         png_byte color_type, bit_depth = ( png_byte )chunks.front().bytesPerVoxel() * 8;
00212 
00213         switch( isis_data_type ) {
00214         case data::ValuePtr<uint8_t>::staticID:
00215         case data::ValuePtr<uint16_t>::staticID:
00216             color_type = PNG_COLOR_TYPE_GRAY;
00217             break;
00218         case data::ValuePtr<util::color24>::staticID:
00219         case data::ValuePtr<util::color48>::staticID:
00220             color_type = PNG_COLOR_TYPE_RGB;
00221             bit_depth /= 3;
00222             break;
00223         default:
00224             LOG( Runtime, error ) << "Sorry, writing images of type " << image.getMajorTypeName() << " is not supportet";
00225             throwGenericError( "unsupported data type" );
00226         }
00227 
00228 
00229         if( util::istring( dialect.c_str() ) == util::istring( "middle" ) ) { //save only the middle
00230             LOG( Runtime, info ) << "Writing the slice " << chunks.size() / 2 + 1 << " of " << chunks.size() << " slices as png-image of size " << chunks.front().getSizeAsString();
00231 
00232             if( !write_png( filename, chunks[chunks.size() / 2], color_type, bit_depth ) ) {
00233                 throwGenericError( std::string( "Failed to write " ) + filename );
00234             }
00235         } else { //save all slices
00236             size_t number = 0;
00237             unsigned short numLen = std::log10( chunks.size() ) + 1;
00238             const std::pair<std::string, std::string> fname = makeBasename( filename );
00239             LOG( Runtime, info )
00240                     << "Writing " << chunks.size() << " slices as png-images " << fname.first << "_"
00241                     << std::string( numLen, 'X' ) << fname.second << " of size " << chunks.front().getSizeAsString();
00242 
00243             BOOST_FOREACH( const data::Chunk & ref, chunks ) {
00244                 const std::string num = boost::lexical_cast<std::string>( ++number );
00245                 const std::string name = fname.first + "_" + std::string( numLen - num.length(), '0' ) + num + fname.second;
00246 
00247                 if( !write_png( name, ref, color_type, bit_depth ) ) {
00248                     throwGenericError( std::string( "Failed to write " ) + name );;
00249                 }
00250             }
00251         }
00252 
00253     }
00254     bool tainted()const {return false;}//internal plugins are not tainted

00258 isis::image_io::FileFormat *factory()

00260     return new isis::image_io::ImageFormat_png();
